title: International Center of Photography Puts Black America in Focus
summary: Fashion photographer Tyler Mitchell has inaugural U.S. show at Center's new Manhattan space. Tyler Mitchell remembers having to sneak onto the photography floor at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts to secure the equipment for some of his earliest photographic work.

title: MAX Operators Lose Ground
summary: American and Southwest say the grounding of Boeing's aircraft has pushed customers to rival airlines. U.S. airlines that operate the Boeing Co. 737 MAX are facing the prospect that the aircraft's prolonged grounding could stymie their growth and benefit competitors well into this year.

title: U.S. Blacklists Foreign Companies Allegedly Supporting Iran's Petroleum Sector
summary: Washington continues to ramp up pressure on Tehran. The U.S. Treasury Department on Thursday blacklisted four foreign companies for allegedly supporting and facilitating Iran's petrochemical and petroleum exports, among the latest efforts by Washington to ramp up pressure on Tehran.

title: Timberland Struggles to Sell Its Classic Boot
summary: Footwear brand's sales fell during the holidays; VF's stock tumbles. Timberland lost its footing in the holiday season.

title: Miami Businessman Pleads Guilty to Ecuadorean Corruption Scheme
summary: Armengol Alfonso Cevallos Diaz conspired to pay bribes to officials at Petroecuador, prosecutors said. A Miami-based businessman pleaded guilty on Thursday to conspiring to pay $4.4 million in bribes to officials at a state-controlled oil company in Ecuador.

title: New York City Bill Would Let Green-Card Holders Vote in Local Elections
summary: Nearly 1 million city residents who aren't citizens would receive the right to vote under the proposed legislation. Green card holders and immigrants with work visas would be able to vote in mayoral races and other elections in New York City under a bill introduced in the City Council on Thursday.

title: New York's Subway Chief Resigns
summary: Andy Byford is leaving after joining Metropolitan Transportation Authority two years ago. The New York Metropolitan Transportation Authority's subway chief resigned Thursday, taking MTA board members, transit advocates and politicians by surprise and raising questions whether his ambitious plan to overhaul the subway will stall.

title: Broadcom Lands Deals to Place Components in Apple Smartphones
summary: Multiyear supply agreement could generate billions in business. Broadcom Inc. said it reached multiyear supply agreements with Apple Inc. to provide wireless components for Apple products into 2023, deals that could generate billions of dollars worth of business.

title: Harvey Weinstein Accuser Annabella Sciorra Testifies: 'I Was Afraid for My Life.'
summary: 'The Sopranos' actress alleges the Hollywood producer raped her in the early 1990s. For decades, actress Annabella Sciorra was silent about her alleged rape by Harvey Weinstein.

title: Trump Signals a Push for Mideast Peace Plan
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, rival Benny Gantz set to come to White House next week. TEL AVIV-President Trump said Thursday he likely would make public his administration's long-delayed plan for peace in the Middle East-under development since 2017-before a visit to Washington next week by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his main political rival, Benny Gantz.

title: Marathon Days Make Many Senators Restless
summary: Long bathroom breaks, questionable reading materials and audible conversations become more common. WASHINGTON-When North Carolina Sen. Richard Burr hosted lunch for his Republican colleagues on Thursday, he gave each senator a practical gift along with their hamburgers, hot dogs and baked beans: a fidget spinner.

title: Founder of Opioid Maker Sentenced to 5½ Years in Prison
summary: John N. Kapoor, who founded Insys Therapeutics, and other executives were convicted in 2019. BOSTON-John N. Kapoor, a former billionaire who founded opioid maker Insys Therapeutics Inc., was sentenced to 5½ years in prison for his role in a racketeering conspiracy to illegally boost sales of his company's prescription fentanyl drug.

title: World's Priciest Precious Metal Surges Amid Emissions Clampdown
summary: Rhodium, which strips toxic gases from exhaust fumes, is in high demand from car makers. The price of rhodium, a precious metal that strips pollutants out of exhaust fumes, is surging as car manufacturers in Asia and Europe scramble to abide by stricter emission regimes.

title: Intel's Earnings Boosted by Data-Center, PC Demand
summary: U.S.'s largest chipmaker also gave an upbeat outlook for the full year. Intel Corp. posted strong fourth-quarter earnings that benefited from an upswing in personal-computer shipments and robust demand for chips to power data centers.

title: Former Daily News Editor in Chief to Run Deadspin
summary: Jim Rich is stepping in to lead the site months after the entire staff resigned to protest the chief executive of parent G/O Media. G/O Media has turned to a veteran editor to lead Deadspin, the sports website that has been rudderless since its entire staff resigned last fall to protest the company's chief executive.

title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon's Compensation Rises to $31.5 Million
summary: He was the highest paid of big-bank bosses in the U.S. for 2018 and likely to retain the crown again. JPMorgan Chase & Co. paid its chief executive, James Dimon, $31.5 million for his work in 2019, a 1.6% boost, as the bank set fresh records in profit and stock price.

title: Greeting Cards Retailer Papyrus Files for Bankruptcy, Plans to Close Stores
summary: Company behind Papyrus and sister retail chains said it filed for bankruptcy after running out of time to find a buyer for the business. Greeting cards and stationery retailer Papyrus filed for bankruptcy Thursday with a plan to close all its stores in the U.S. and Canada after it was unable to find a buyer to keep its stores and sister outlets, American Greetings, Carlton Cards and Paper Destiny, in business.

title: George Soros Commits $1 Billion to Educational Initiative
summary: Billionaire envisions collaborative effort by universities to promote 'personal autonomy'. DAVOS, Switzerland-George Soros, the billionaire hedge fund manager-turned-philanthropist, said he was committing $1 billion to fund a loose network of universities around the world to help educate young people and promote "personal autonomy."

title: Fed Repos Add $74.2 Billion, But Net Liquidity Declines Modestly
summary: Because of past operations expiring, outstanding short-term Fed liquidity injections fell by $10 billion to $176.1 billion. The Federal Reserve Bank of New York intervened on Thursday with two temporary additions of liquidity that nevertheless amounted to a modest reduction in the overall amount of temporary liquidity the central bank is adding to financial markets.

title: 'The Gentlemen': Blithe Thuggery With Flair to Spare
summary: Guy Ritchie's latest is a throwback to his rough-and-tumble, intricately plotted capers.. Guy Ritchie's "The Gentlemen" expands the concept of a selfie-mostly to the good, as far as it goes. It's a movie in which pleasingly self-enchanted actors play comically self-important characters pursuing elaborately self-serving schemes. Yet the story's appeal is self-limiting, since the substance matters less than the self-referential style, the reference being to Mr. Ritchie's early films in exactly the same vein.

title: 'The Last Full Measure' Review: A Hero's Tale Clumsily Told
summary: The story of William H. Pitsenbarger, a pararescue specialist in Vietnam, mixes fact with flimsy fiction.. 'The Last Full Measure" does not, sad to say, measure up to its aspirations.

title: Union-Pacific Says It Will Need 3,000 Fewer Workers in 2020
summary: Railroad, like its rivals, continues to streamline operations; quarterly profit fell 10%. Union Pacific Corp. plans to run its railroad with nearly 3,000 fewer workers this year as the company pushes ahead with a new operating plan that runs fewer, longer trains.

title: U.S. Treasury Yields Extend Declines
summary: Yields slide on concerns over spread of deadly virus in China. U.S. government yields extended a recent decline after concerns around the coronavirus outbreak in China drove investors to the relative safety of traditional havens.

title: Tylenol May Be Key to Curing Boeing Headache
summary: Instead of renaming the Boeing 737 MAX, Boeing needs to go overboard in making the plane safe to restore its reputation. That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet. Would a Boeing 737 MAX by some other name seem less dangerous?

title: Energy Companies Darken S&P 500 Profit Picture
summary: Shares of energy companies in the broad index have lost 5.3% so far this month. Corporate profits across the S&P 500 look a little brighter without energy companies in the mix.

title: Puerto Rico Grid Contractor Faces Mounting Claims From Bribery Probe
summary: Rival contractor sues Mammoth Energy Services, alleging it was cheated out of business in Puerto Rico. Mammoth Energy Services Inc., which rebuilt much of Puerto Rico's power grid after Hurricane Maria, is facing a lawsuit alleging the company paid bribes to cheat a competing contractor out of $500 million in government business.

title: 'A Soldier's Play' Review: Race Relations and Wartime Woes
summary: In this Broadway revival, the 1944 murder of a black sergeant has an investigator wondering if he was killed by the Klan or one of his own men.. New York

title: U.S. Stocks Recoup Steep Losses
summary: Dow ends day slightly lower after Shanghai Composite Index slides 2.8%. The Dow Jones Industrial Average recouped most of its losses Thursday but remained in the red as mixed earnings reports and a worsening viral outbreak unsettled investors.

title: Larry Fink of BlackRock Plays Politics With Other People's Money
summary: The CEO is failing to honor securities law, specifically the legislation governing investment companies, and his fiduciary obligations to investors.. Your editorial "Larry Fink's Latest Sermon" (Jan. 18), which points out the curious motivation for BlackRock CEO Larry Fink's position, is well taken but doesn't go far enough. Mr. Fink is failing to honor both securities law, specifically the legislation governing investment companies, and his fiduciary obligations to investors.

title: 'The Goop Lab' Review: Experiments Gone Awry
summary: Gwyneth Paltrow's Netflix project is more informercial for her semi-notorious lifestyle brand than a show.. Like a visit to the zoo, "The Goop Lab" provides an opportunity to observe, at safe distance, a subspecies seldom seen in the wild-a strain of Elitus americanus that has evolved in a Southern California atmosphere of cosmetic perfection, no evident stressors and with a profound cluelessness regarding its own entitlement. That, or Gwyneth Paltrow is just trolling us. Aided and abetted by Netflix.

title: 'The Poison Squad' Review: A Spoonful of Borax Helps the Rancid Meat Go Down
summary: A look at the group of human guinea pigs that tested the dangers of food additives in the early 20th century.. Regulation can be a dirty word to American business, but "The Poison Squad"-the story of Harvey Wiley and his decades-long campaign to tame the Wild West of American food-does an inspiring job of detailing how filthy things can get when you don't have any regulation at all.

title: Jim Lehrer of PBS's 'NewsHour' Dies at 85
summary: Longtime anchor was a frequent moderator of presidential debates and a writer. Jim Lehrer, the even-keeled Public Broadcasting Service anchor who won high marks across the political spectrum for his fair-minded, in-depth approach to journalism over a decadeslong career, has died. He was 85 years old.

title: U.S. Should Strengthen Its Korean Alliance
summary: Instead of strategically prioritizing ways in which our two nations can better promote progress with North Korea and serve as a check on China's influence, the administration has chosen to weaken our leverage.. In "South Korea Is an Ally, Not a Dependent" (op-ed, Jan. 17), Secretaries Michael R. Pompeo and Mark T. Esper argue that the scope of challenges South Korea and the U.S. face means "neither country can afford to allow the status quo to continue." In a sense, they're right. The status quo of the Trump administration weakening one of our country's most important allies is unacceptable and unsustainable. South Korea is literally at the front line of threats posed by North Korea and China, two national-security priorities that Messrs. Esper and Pompeo noticeably omit. According to the Trump administration's defense strategy, these two threats rank at the very top of our global concerns, and cultivating and strengthening key allies like South Korea to counter these threats is one of our most vital tools.

title: Dr. King Would Be Sad About Our Identity Politics
summary: To grotesquely weaponize race for partisan political purposes doesn't just diminish Dr. King's legacy, it diminishes us all.. Regarding Robert L. Woodson's "The Left Forgets What Martin Luther King Stood For" (op-ed, Jan. 18): On Monday the nation remembered and honored the powerful legacy of the Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. Yet in today's highly polarized political environment, replete with the sharp-elbowed tactics of Washington infighting, much of King's work has apparently been forgotten.

title: Tax, Interest-Rate Policies Penalize Frugal Retirees
summary: One group the Trump administration's tax reform isn't working well for are the frugal retired.. Stephen Moore claims that the 2017 tax reform "is working like a charm for all income groups" (Letters, Jan. 11).

title: Drugmakers Rush to Develop Vaccines Against China Virus
summary: First tests of the research could occur within a few months, but approval would take longer. Several drugmakers are racing to develop vaccines that could protect against the new respiratory virus originating in China, as fears mount it could spread more widely.

title: CVS Co-Founder's Career Was Disrupted by Social Activism
summary: Ralph Hoagland's political activism precipitated his exit from the drugstore chain he helped create. In the 1960s, Ralph Hoagland was a hard-charging, Harvard-educated entrepreneur whose idealistic crusades for social justice disrupted a promising business career.

title: Indian Health Service Faces Civil Suit Over Alleged Sexual Abuse
summary: Alleged victims seek compensation from the U.S. government for failing to protect them from pediatrician Stanley Patrick Weber. Three Native American men filed a civil lawsuit alleging that the U.S. Indian Health Service failed to protect them from sexual abuse by a pediatrician, Stanley Patrick Weber, in Montana during the 1990s, a federal court filing shows.

title: Justice Department Believes It Should Have Ended Surveillance of Trump Adviser Earlier
summary: Government tells court it lacked probable cause in last two of four eavesdropping applications for Carter Page. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department now believes it should have discontinued its secret surveillance of one-time Trump campaign adviser Carter Page far earlier than it did, according to a new court filing unsealed Thursday.

title: Best-Selling Books Week Ended January 18
summary: With data from NPD BookScan.

title: Schiff, Hamilton and Impeachment
summary: Plus, new allegations against Senate jurors.. Senate jurors are responding in different ways to the impeachment case being made by House Democrats. "Gum-chewing, snacking, yawning and alleged napping could be seen throughout the cramped chamber," reports Laurie Kellman of the Associated Press. But just because a prosecution's case is boring doesn't mean it can't also be misleading. Senators should take care to examine the historical record on impeachments.

title: Athletes Reach Deal to Gain Funding but Stay Under U.S. Olympic Wing
summary: The Athletes' Advisory Council, which considered forming a group outside the U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Committee, instead will hire an executive director. The U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Committee will increase financial support of its athlete council, the organization said Thursday, a move that comes after athletes called for a more powerful voice in the wake of sexual abuse scandals.

title: Xerox to Nominate 11 Candidates to Replace HP's Board
summary: Move comes as Xerox pushes $33 billion unsolicited takeover bid for maker of computers and printers. Xerox Holdings Corp. said it plans to nominate 11 independent candidates to replace HP Inc.'s board at the computer and printer maker's annual shareholder meeting this summer.

title: Commodities Fall Alongside Global Stocks With Coronavirus Spreading
summary: The slide comes amid signs that investors are bracing for a hit to economic growth in China. Commodities from oil to copper extended a recent slide Thursday with a deadly virus spreading and disrupting travel in China, the latest sign that investors are bracing for a hit to economic growth in the world's largest consumer of raw materials.

title: A New Look at Britain's Old Treasures
summary: Redesigned galleries at New York's Metropolitan Museum showcase four centuries of decorative art.. On March 2, New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art will reopen its British galleries, following a complete renovation lasting more than three years. The old British galleries, created in the 1980s, were "too old-fashioned," says Met curator Wolf Burchard. They "focused primarily on aristocratic patronage and collecting," including three rooms recreated from 18th-century mansions. Despite their prime first-floor location, Mr. Burchard recalls, "nobody ever went there."

title: Amtrak's New Acela Fleet May Not Be on Time
summary: Railroad's inspector general cites delays in manufacturing, contracts. WASHINGTON-Amtrak's plans to launch a new fleet of higher capacity Acela trains next year could be jeopardized by manufacturing and contract delays, the railroad's inspector general warned in a report Thursday.

title: State Department to Restrict U.S. Travel for Pregnant Foreigners
summary: Rules designed to crack down on what Trump administration calls 'birth tourism'. WASHINGTON-The State Department is adopting a new set of rules that will make it tougher for pregnant foreigners to visit the U.S. on tourist visas, an effort to prevent individuals from coming to the U.S. to give birth.

title: ECB Indicates It Will Leave Negative Rates In Place for Some Time
summary: Lagarde says eurozone economy still faces 'downside risks' from rising protectionism despite the U.S. and China signing a trade deal. FRANKFURT-The European Central Bank signaled it will leave negative interest rates in place for some time, despite growing misgivings with the unconventional policy tool, as trade tensions continue to drag on the export-focused eurozone economy.

title: PG&E Makes Peace With Bondholders; Strife With Governor Continues
summary: Utility deals away threat of a bondholder takeover in bankruptcy, but threat of state takeover perseveres. PG&E Corp. has reached an accord with bondholders that smooths its path out of bankruptcy, but it has yet to win over California Gov. Gavin Newsom, who has threatened a state takeover of the embattled utility.

title: 2020 Ferrari Portofino: An Everyday Supercar for the Very Wealthy
summary: The effortlessness of its steering and added (if expected) tech, such as parking-assist cameras and a touch-screen user interface, make the Portofino Ferrari's most driveable car to date, says Dan Neil. But don't expect these add-ons to come at a discount. JACKSON IS A 9-year-old boy who lives in my neighborhood. He loves cars, something fierce. "Can you get a Ferrari?" he asked me not long ago. Why, yes, in fact I'm expecting a delivery from the big red stork any day.

title: Archbishop's Retirement Removes a Conservative Champion in the U.S.
summary: Charles Chaput espoused traditional church teaching on marriage and sexuality, a stance at odds with Pope Francis' more liberal agenda. title: Global Financial Watchdog Restores Vatican's Active Membership
summary: Readmission to Egmont network boosts financial credibility of Holy See's regulator, which had come under fire over security concerns. title: Europe to Avoid Triggering Sanctions if Iran Limits Nuclear Expansion
summary: Iran has taken no fresh steps to escalate nuclear work in weeks, European diplomats say. BRUSSELS-European powers won't move to reimpose international sanctions on Iran and kill the 2015 nuclear deal as long as Tehran restrains expansion of its nuclear work, diplomats said, potentially increasing tensions with the Trump administration.

title: Kotex Decides Women's Blood Is Red, Not Blue
summary: New maxi-pad ads, taking a page from startups, depict lifelike menstrual blood. Blood is no longer blue for Kotex.

title: Help! I'm Trapped Inside TikTok and I Can't Get Out
summary: Explore the TikTok features that make it the most habit-forming social app out there. I probably should've known I had a problem when I recorded myself affixing an AirPod to the heel of my dirty sock with packing tape. Or maybe when I wasted an hour watching people turn Diet Coke bottles into spray cannons using Mentos. Perhaps the Friday night I spent trying to record my dog holding an iPhone was a clue.

title: America Looks Toward the Future as Alysa Liu Defends Her U.S. Figure Skating Title
summary: The 14-year-old is the only American female skater with the blockbuster jumps to keep up with the world's elite. When 14-year-old U.S. ladies figure skating champion Alysa Liu was asked to shoot a music video, one consideration was child labor laws. Those aren't at issue in Liu's 28-hour-a-week training schedule as she seeks to keep her American dominance in the long two years between now and the next Winter Olympic Games.

title: Xerox Finds a Hostile Way to Get Friendly
summary: Replacing HP's board of directors could make the company a buyer. For those who think it is crazy for Xerox to acquire the much larger HP Inc., the photocopier pioneer may be handed a creative way to switch roles.

summary: The insurer has been the most prominent so far to attribute losses to the rise of 'social inflation'. Travelers Cos.'s earnings rose in the fourth quarter, but the company said it faced higher-than-expected claims payments for lawsuits and jury awards.

summary: In a period of strong profitability for U.S. carriers, Latin America offers juicy growth prospects-as long as competition doesn't get out of hand. When companies make a lot of money, they often look for a place to put it. In the case of U.S. airlines, that place could be Latin America.

title: The Koch Brothers Are Sitting on a Real Estate Empire Worth Hundreds of Millions
summary: Charles and his late brother David, as well as two other siblings, have purchased some of the most remarkable homes in the world. A look at their valuable portfolio. But they, and their two brothers, Bill and Frederick, quietly built another legacy: hundreds of millions of dollars worth of high-end real estate.

summary: Shares of Trillium Therapeutics have surged more than 10-fold since December. Never underestimate what a bull market can accomplish.

summary: Cable giant increases dividend by 10% for second year in a row. Cable giant Comcast Corp.'s net profit rose 26% in the fourth quarter, once again riding on the back of internet subscriber growth amid continued pay-TV customer losses.

title: Royal Treasures, Lost and Found
summary: From Montezuma's gold to the crown jewels of Scotland, some of the world's most famous valuables have gone missing.. What sort of nitwit goes off in a snowstorm to feed leftovers to the chickens while still wearing her Christmas Day finery? In my defense, I was just trying to share the love. Alas, I ended up sharing an antique ring along with the Brussels sprouts. Only the chickens know where it is, and they aren't talking.

title: Central Banks Warm to Issuing Digital Currencies
summary: One in 10 central banks surveyed says it is likely to roll out digital currencies within three years. title: Reagan Arthur to Become Knopf Editorial Head
summary: Parent Penguin Random House also tapped Maya Mavjee as publisher of Knopf Doubleday. Publishing veteran Reagan Arthur will succeed the late Ajai Singh "Sonny" Mehta as the editorial head of the Alfred A. Knopf imprint, one of the country's most prestigious book publishers.

title: Ignore the Fake Climate Debate
summary: The deniers and alarmists may make headlines, but behind the scenes, an expert consensus is taking shape on how to respond to global warming.. Beyond the headlines and social media, where Greta Thunberg, Donald Trump and the online armies of climate "alarmists" and "deniers" do battle, there is a real climate debate bubbling along in scientific journals, conferences and, occasionally, even in the halls of Congress. It gets a lot less attention than the boisterous and fake debate that dominates our public discourse, but it is much more relevant to how the world might actually address the problem.

title: Attorneys Make Rare Push to Exonerate an Executed Man
summary: Lawyers usually save their efforts for the living but are making an exception for Ledell Lee, who was put to death in Arkansas for murder in 2017. A case in Arkansas will test the limits of an inmate's right to clear his name even after he has been put to death.

title: Fairway Files For Chapter 11, Proposing Sale to Village Super Market

Fairway Market, the iconic New York City grocery chain, filed for bankruptcy protection with a proposal to sell its Manhattan stores to the Village Super Market Inc., a member of the Wakefern Food Corp. cooperative.

title: Largest U.S. Gun Show Tries to Lure Women, First-Time Buyers
summary: Some states relax laws on concealed weapons, creating more demand for small firearms. LAS VEGAS-At the nation's largest gun trade show this week, gun makers made a big pitch for women and first-time buyers interested in carrying concealed guns, groups they say are growing.

title: Selling Your Home? It's What's on the Outside That Counts.
summary: A new study quantifying the impact of curb appeal found that the attractiveness of a home can boost its value by 7% or more. Want to get top dollar for your house? Mow the lawn.

title: Biden Tax Plan Raises Majority of Money From Top 0.1% of Households
summary: In all, the Democratic presidential contender's tax-increase plans would raise $2.6 trillion over a decade. WASHINGTON-Former Vice President Joe Biden's tax agenda would generate more than half its money from the top 0.1% of U.S. households, raising their average tax bills by more than $1 million and reducing their after-tax income by 14%, according to an estimate released Thursday from the Penn-Wharton Budget Model.

title: Average Age of CIOs Nudges Higher

summary: Hedge funds spent most of their cash on M&A campaigns in 2019, a trend that should continue this year. Disrupting deals has always been a preferred tactic of activist investors, but they are becoming even more partial to it.

summary: Liquidations are more prevalent in retail bankruptcies while top lenders recover on average 91 cents on the dollar, according to research by Fitch Ratings.

The book, paced like a thriller, is set in an old Philadelphia neighborhood buckling under the weight of the opioid crisis.

Some folks are upset about Jeter not being voted in unanimously, but look: Willie Mays didn't get voted in unanimously, so what are we grumbling about here? Listening to baseball lunatics argue over Hall of Fame voting is like listening to my children argue over their Legos while sitting in a pillow fort. At first, it's adorable. But after a while...

title: U.N. Court Orders Myanmar to Take Steps to Protect Rohingya Muslims
summary: International Court of Justice rejects country's arguments that international intervention is unwarranted. title: Ebullient Mood in Davos Should Put Investors on Edge
summary: Stocks are more expensive than at any time since 2002, but the world's business elite doesn't seem to care, a sign that a fresh round of complacency may be at hand. The Davos consensus can be a powerful counter-indicator, but this year it is worrying me for all the wrong reasons.

title: Younger Workers Feel Lonely at the Office
summary: Most Popular News. They have friends at work and good relationships with their managers. But younger employees still feel alone at the office, according to a new survey.

title: Shadow Banks Come Into the Light in Global Lending
summary: Nonbank financial institutions have a growing presence in cross-border credit, but we won't know the real effect until a downturn arrives. In cross-border credit, regular banks are out, and shadow banks are in. Our limited knowledge about how the latter will behave in a downturn is a reason for concern.

title: Facing Pushback From Allies, U.S. Set for Broader Huawei Effort
summary: U.K. officials have indicated they would restrict but not forbid the use of Huawei equipment. BEIJING-The U.S. is preparing for a longer and broader campaign to banish Huawei Technologies Co. from next-generation 5G cellular networks around the world, as Washington faces resistance on the front line of its lobbying campaign, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Unions Gain Clout as Democrats Seek Primary Endorsements
summary: Unlike in 2016, many of the nation's largest and medium-size unions haven't yet issued endorsements. LOS ANGELES-The workers represented by Rachel Sulkes's union had reached an impasse in negotiations with food-services provider Sodexo . So Ms. Sulkes and her team turned to the 2020 field, announcing in mid-December that the union would picket outside the coming Democratic debate at Loyola Marymount University.

title: Intel's Chip Shortage, Competition in Focus: What to Watch
summary: The chip maker has benefited from the growing trend toward cloud computing. Intel Corp. is expected to report fiscal fourth-quarter earnings Thursday after the market closes. The results come as the chip maker tries to resolve supply shortages and protect its dominant market position from growing competition by rival Advanced Micro Devices Inc. Here's what to expect:

title: Russia's Parliament Passes Putin's Constitutional Plans on First Reading
summary: Proposals could allow Russia's president to exercise power beyond his 2024 term limit. MOSCOW-Russia's parliament on Thursday gave preliminary approval to President Vladimir Putin's constitutional overhaul, a move that could allow him to maintain control over the country's political scene after his term ends in 2024.

title: Wuhan Virus Could Hit China's Economy Harder Than SARS
summary: The new consumer-led economy has many advantages-but it is also more vulnerable to a SARS-like epidemic. China is again struggling with a frightening respiratory infection ahead of the Lunar New Year, when hundreds of millions journey home or abroad for the nation's most important family holiday.

title: Coming Soon to Tinder: Panic Buttons and Safety Check-Ins
summary: Dating app's partner will send police if users feel threatened; company says many are comfortable with the privacy trade-off. Tinder wants to allow users to send out an alarm when bad dates turn really ugly.

title: Three U.S. Firefighters Killed in Plane Crash Fighting Australian Wildfires
summary: The plane operated under contract by Coulson Aviation, part of a Canadian company. Authorities are investigating the cause of the crash.. SYDNEY-Three American firefighters were killed after their air-tanker crashed while battling wildfires ravaging southeastern Australia.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Democrats Present Their Case for Trump's Removal
summary: House impeachment managers argue president interfered in 2020 election by seeking probe of Bidens by Ukraine. WASHINGTON-House Democrats argued that President Trump's efforts to press Ukraine to launch investigations that could help him politically warranted his removal from office, saying during the first day of opening arguments in the impeachment trial that his actions undercut U.S. elections and national security.

title: U.N. Suggests Bezos' Phone Was Hacked Using Saudi Crown Prince's Account
summary: Separately, federal prosecutors probe whether racy photos of Amazon boss were provided to National Enquirer by his girlfriend's brother. Two United Nations officials said Washington Post owner Jeff Bezos was likely hacked using a WhatsApp account associated with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in an attempt to influence news coverage of the kingdom.

title: Trump to Speak at Annual March for Life
summary: President has won plaudits from antiabortion advocates for his efforts to restrict abortion access. President Trump plans to speak at the March for Life in Washington Friday, making him the first president to attend the antiabortion march in person in the event's history.

title: China Locks Down City at Center of Coronavirus Outbreak
summary: Wuhan to halt all outbound flights and trains as authorities try to stem spread of new pneumonialike illness ahead of Lunar New Year; death toll jumps to at least 17. WUHAN, China-The city in central China where a new coronavirus originated will halt outbound flights and trains and shut its public-transportation system, the Chinese government said, a dramatic escalation in the battle to contain a pneumonia outbreak that has killed at least 17 people.

title: PG&E Strikes Deal With Bondholders as Governor Blasts Bankruptcy Strategy
summary: Utility's deal with bondholders eases tensions with one key creditor group as California governor again raises threat of a state takeover. PG&E Corp. said Wednesday it has reached a new deal with bondholders that threatened opposition to its strategy for getting out of bankruptcy, but friction continues with California Gov. Gavin Newsom, who has threatened a state takeover of the troubled utility.

title: European High-Yield Bond Rally May Be Over-Hyped
summary: Speculative-grade corporate bonds see bullish start to 2020. Spanish bridge and railway builders topped few lists for winning bets at the start of 2020, but speculative-grade bonds in two such companies have jumped in price this year.

title: U.S. Withholds Support for New Lebanon Government
summary: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo withheld support for Lebanon's government as it met for the first time. BEIRUT-Lebanon's new government received a tepid welcome on Wednesday as police used water cannons to prevent protesters from marching on parliament and the Trump administration said it wasn't certain it would work with the coalition dominated by Iranian ally Hezbollah and its Christian allies.

title: Political Turmoil Triggers Slump in Italian Assets
summary: Bond yields rise as the leader of Italy's 5 Star Movement resigns. Italian assets slumped Wednesday as fresh political uncertainty threatened to derail reforms and pose a further setback to the troubled economy.

title: Duff & Phelps Reunites With Former Owners Through $4.2 Billion Deal
summary: Stone Point Capital, which backed Duff & Phelps between 2013 and 2015, plans to reacquire the company alongside Further Global. Call it a reunion, of sorts.

title: Pompeo's Jamaica Visit Divides Caribbean Over Venezuela
summary: Meeting in Kingston reveals fissures over neutrality and regional alliance. KINGSTON, Jamaica-Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Wednesday encountered a Caribbean region divided over U.S. policy toward Venezuela as he sought to rally regional support behind U.S. efforts to oust Nicolás Maduro.
